## Average transition matrix

```{r simulation}
start_date = '1980-01-01'
states = c('E', 'U', 'N') #E=employed, U=unemployed, N - Not in Labor force 

tr_matrix = t(matrix(c(0.99, 0.01, 0.0, 
                       0.1,   0.8, 0.1,
                       0.0,   0.1, 0.9), nrow = 3))

tr_matrix_from_params <- function(tr_rates){
  r_eu = exp( tr_rates[1] ) / (1 + exp( tr_rates[1] ))
  
  r_ue = exp( tr_rates[2] ) / (1 + exp(tr_rates[2]) + exp(tr_rates[3]) )
  r_un = exp( tr_rates[3] ) / (1 + exp(tr_rates[2]) + exp(tr_rates[3]) )
  
  r_nu = exp( tr_rates[4] ) / (1 + exp(tr_rates[4])) 
  
  tr_temp = t(matrix(c(1-r_eu, r_eu, 0.0, 
                       r_ue,   1-r_un-r_ue, r_un,
                       0.0,   r_nu, 1-r_nu), nrow = 3))
  return (tr_temp)
} 

#static monthly
obj_fun <-function(tr_rates_params){
  tr_temp = tr_matrix_from_params(tr_rates_params)
  
  st = df[order(date) & date>=start_date,.(lpart * (1 - 0.01*uer),0.01*lpart * uer, 100-lpart  )]
  st_next = as.matrix(st) %*% (tr_temp)
  
  res = st[-1,] - st_next[-nrow(st_next),]
  return ( norm(as.matrix(res), type = 'F') )
}

#dynamic
obj_fun2 <-function(tr_rates_params){
  
  st = df[order(date) & date>=start_date,.(lpart * (1 - 0.01*uer),0.01*lpart * uer, 100-lpart  )]
  t_eu = df[order(date) & date>=start_date,  0.1*iuic * (52/12) / (pop * lpart * (1 - 0.01*uer)) ]
  
  st_next = as.matrix(st)
  
  for(i in 1:(nrow(st)-1)){
    st_next[i+1,] = st_next[i,] %*% (tr_matrix_from_params(c(logit(t_eu[i] * tr_rates_params[1] ), tr_rates_params[-1])))
  }
  
  #ggplot() + geom_line(data = cbind(st, df[order(date) & date>=start_date, .(date) ]), aes(date, V2), inherit.aes = FALSE) + geom_line(data = cbind(st_next, df[order(date) & date>=start_date, .(date) ]), aes(date, V2), inherit.aes = FALSE, color = 'red')
  #ggplot() + geom_line(data = cbind(st, df[order(date) & date>=start_date, .(date) ]), aes(date, V1), inherit.aes = FALSE) + geom_line(data = cbind(st_next, df[order(date) & date>=start_date, .(date) ]), aes(date, V1), inherit.aes = FALSE, color = 'red')
  #ggplot() + geom_line(data = cbind(st, df[order(date) & date>=start_date, .(date) ]), aes(date, V3), inherit.aes = FALSE) + geom_line(data = cbind(st_next, df[order(date) & date>=start_date, .(date) ]), aes(date, V3), inherit.aes = FALSE, color = 'red')
  
  
  res = st - st_next
  return ( norm(as.matrix(res), type = 'F') )
}


tr_rates_params = c(-5.916822,  -3.176981, -11.613970, -14.549339)#static monthly params
res = optim(tr_rates, obj_fun, method = 'L-BFGS', control = list(trace = TRUE))
#res = optim(tr_rates, obj_fun, method = 'Nelder-Mead', control = list(trace = TRUE, maxit =  500))

tr_rates_params_dyn = c(  0.4393218,  -2.5398041, -23.4553341, -10.0342715)#static monthly params
res = optim(tr_rates_params_dyn, obj_fun2, method = 'L-BFGS-B', control = list(trace = TRUE), lower = c(0.1, rep(-Inf,3)), upper = c(2, rep(Inf,3)) )
#res = optim(tr_rates_params_dyn, obj_fun2, method = 'Nelder-Mead', control = list(trace = TRUE, maxit =  500))

tr_matrix = tr_matrix_from_params(c(logit(0.01 * tr_rates_params_dyn[1] ), tr_rates_params_dyn[-1]))
start_states %*% (tr_matrix %^% 30)
```

## Create MC simulation simulation

```{r mc_simulation}

start_date = '1980-01-01'
states = c('E', 'U', 'N') #E=employed, U=unemployed, N - Not in Labor force 
n = 10000 #number of people

tr_matrix =  tr_matrix_from_params( c(-5.916822,  -3.176981, -11.613970, -14.549339))

start_states = as.numeric(df[date==start_date,.(lpart * (1 - 0.01*uer),0.01*lpart * uer, 100-lpart  )])
 
start_states %*% (tr_matrix %^% 30)

rownames(tr_matrix)<-states
colnames(tr_matrix)<-states
#rowSums(tr_matrix)

df_s = df[order(date) & date>=start_date,.(date, E = lpart * (1 - 0.01*uer), U = 0.01*lpart * uer, N = 100-lpart, UER = uer  )]

df_s[, t := seq(0, nrow(df_s)-1)]

#ts is time in state
dt_temp =  data.table(id = seq(n), t = 0, ts = 0, state = sample(states, n, replace = TRUE, prob = c(59.9680, 4.0320, 36.0) ) )

df_sim = foreach (i = seq(nrow(df_s)-1), .combine = rbind) %do% {
#df_sim = foreach (i = seq(240), .combine = rbind) %do% {
  
  cur_states = dt_temp[,state]
  ts = dt_temp[,ts]
  
  for (j in 1:nrow(dt_temp)){
    cur_state = cur_states[j]
    probs = tr_matrix[which(states == cur_state),]
    next_state = states[which(cumsum(probs) >= runif(1))[1]]
    ts[j] = ifelse(next_state == cur_state, ts[j] + 1, 0)
    cur_states[j] = next_state
  }
 res = data.table(id = dt_temp$id, t = i, ts, state = cur_states)
 dt_temp = res
 return(res)
}

df_agg = df_sim[, .(.N), by = .(t, state)]

ggplot(dcast(df_agg, t ~ state, value.var = 'N'), aes(t, 100*U/(E+U))) + geom_line() +
  geom_line(data = df_s, aes(t, UER), color = 'red')

```
